tweets.html:
RT @Elle_G_Lewys: Excellent! ..not a problem! What a relief! Right! #Olympics2012 http://t.co/4ci8LSjI

— Hugh Bonneville (@hughbon) July 23, 2012

I think the BBC's 25th Olympic channel should be of the inside of a train stuck outside London Bridge station

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) July 23, 2012

I hope a large chunk of the London #Olympics Opening Ceremonies involves Simon Pegg killing zombies.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 24, 2012

I'm sitting with @ErikMAdams, @AlyssaRosenberg, @HitFixDaniel, @sepinwall, and @TVTherapy. Lotsa will-they/won't-they tension here. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 23, 2012

Confession: I am going to the So You Think You Can Dance panel to gather Nigel anecdotes for my grandmother. #TCAs2012

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) July 23, 2012

First panel is for #SYTYCD. I'm probably going to mostly ignore it, but Cat Deeley is going to force us all to wake up. #tcas12 #fox

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 23, 2012

Cat Deeley inevitable raises the in-room enthusiasm by 65%. #RealTCAs12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 23, 2012

i want Cat Deeley to be proud of me for something. She just seems so supportive. #tcas12 #sytycd

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 23, 2012

#SYTCYD is increasing awareness of dance in America: Nigel Lythgoe is a job creator! #TCAs2012

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) July 23, 2012

Burley thinks Burley can dance.

— Burley (@BurleytheKoala) July 23, 2012

"I think British people enjoy not liking people." Lucy Punch, attempting to boil down our comedy differences. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 23, 2012

Definite panel win for Dana Fox and "Ben & Kate." All we want is to be won over. #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 23, 2012

I primarily come to #TCAs12 to get sense of if producers for new shows have any idea what they're doing. Even more hope for B&K now. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 23, 2012

Kevin Reilly is talking about Glee. Oh, that's adorable. Like anyone cares.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 23, 2012

"If we repopulate Ohio..." -- Kevin Reilly, either discussing "Glee" or life after the apocalypse. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 23, 2012

In "Mobbed Doctor," Howie Mandel plays a urologist constantly abruptly leaving surgeries to join flash mobs.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 23, 2012

I would like to see Fox develop FLASH MOB DOCTOR, in which surgeons descend on Times Square to spring appendectomies on people. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 23, 2012

If @ErikMAdams starts tweeting that a lady right behind him is humming along with the Fox music playing during lunch, that's me. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 23, 2012

If @nprmonkeysee tweets that the guy sitting in front of her at #TCAs12 can't seem to type out a thought without first clapping, it's me.

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) July 23, 2012

The Mob Doctor's name is Grace [for "grace"] Devlin [for "Devil"]. Her middle name is "Conflictoria." #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 23, 2012

"A race horse with an uncontrollable erection." -- description of an upcoming MOB DOCTOR episode. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 23, 2012

The Mob Doctor will have a storyline about stealing semen from a race horse. Line forms to the left, cast of #Luck #TCAs12

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) July 23, 2012

How many dead horses will it take to kill MOB DOCTOR? #TCAs12

— Jace Lacob (@televisionary) July 23, 2012

By the way, that's a real MOB DOCTOR story. If it were me making it up, it would be a show called UNCONTROLLABLE HORSE ERECTION. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 23, 2012

Things I did not see happening -- the most tweeted about thing re: #TheMobDoctor panel is horse erections. #tcas12

— Marisa Roffman (@marisaroffman) July 23, 2012

MOB DOCTOR producer Rob Wright is a big BREAKING BAD fan, or as he would have titled it, CANCER DRUG TEACHER #tcas12

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) July 23, 2012

Having Britney and Demi Lovato on a judging panel is like casting Margo Channing and Eve Harrington in the same play.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 23, 2012

Demi's qualification for being a judge is that she's "listening to the radio right now." This season is going to be perfect. #tcas12

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) July 23, 2012

Brit Brit and Burl Burl

— Burley (@BurleytheKoala) July 23, 2012

There was a loud, snapping sound. I think Nicole Scherzinger was executed just off-camera. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 23, 2012

If Britney Spears watches this satellite feed, she'll make sure that she's never seated next to Demi Lovato ever again.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 23, 2012

Britney is staring just off camera, at nothing in particular, possibly imagining a happy place that remains just out of reach. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 23, 2012

Brtiney Spears seems at a loss when not offering canned responses during #TCA12 press conference...

— Eric Deggans at NPR (@Deggans) July 23, 2012

Is the "Leave Britney Alone" guy in Miami? Sounds like she could use him right about now.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 23, 2012

Demi Lovato is going to be our first female president. #getreadyamerica #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 23, 2012

The ratio of #TCAs2012 tweets about "TV" versus tweets about "food at the event" is about 1:1 at this point.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 23, 2012

"It's not all about yelling and screaming." Gordon Ramsay is ALSO in the denial stage. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 23, 2012

General hygiene is worst thing about places he visits in "Hotel Hell," Gordon Ramsay says. Scared to go back to my room. #tcas12 #fox

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) July 23, 2012

Gordon Ramsey is making me never want to leave my house again with his stories about lack of hotel hygiene. #TCAs12 #HotelHell #Fox

— MariaElena Fernandez (@writerchica) July 23, 2012

Ramsay says you should never accept an upgrade to the honeymoon suite. He suggests you keep your black light with you. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 23, 2012

I wonder what the Beverly Hilton thinks of Fox/Gordon Ramsay giving us critics a portable blacklight to inspect our rooms.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 23, 2012

there is no way I'm using this black light on my hotel room. I am way too scared. #tca12

— Paige Albiniak (@PaigeA) July 23, 2012

"As a nation, we need to complain more," says Gordon Ramsay, who clearly never post a negative "Dark Knight Rises" review online.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 23, 2012

Ramsay, by the way, is very nice. I just wouldn't want to bump into him or something.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 23, 2012

"Nobody say Katie Holmes. Nobody say Katie Holmes. NOBODY SAY KATIE HOLMES." -- me, using telepathy while watching Fringe panel

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 23, 2012

I like the way Josh Jackson does everything that Josh Jackson does while he is Josh Jackson.

— carina adly mackenzie (@cadlymack) July 23, 2012

"We can have parties with every single fan in attendance." -JJ Abrams on the upside of #Fringe having a tiny audience

— Lacey Rose (@LaceyVRose) July 23, 2012

Someone please cast Josh Jackson in a TV series after #Fringe ends.

— Vlada Gelman (@VladaGelman) July 23, 2012

OK so having spent most of the day at TCA I'm convinced more than ever that TCA is broke...possibly beyond repair #TCAs12

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) July 24, 2012

The universe sounds exactly like Tommy Wiseau when it speaks. Scientific FACT.

— A.S. Paul (@aspaul) July 23, 2012

Mike is dishing out half measures all over the place. #BreakingBad

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 23, 2012

Every second that Walter Jr. is on screen is a second that Jesse Pinkman isn't on screen and that is not okay! #BreakingBad

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) July 23, 2012

Life has now become waiting for the next episode of Breaking Bad.

— marc maron (@marcmaron) July 24, 2012

OK, now that we're past the "Breaking Bad" spoiler window, I have to say it: I could listen to that German researcher say "Franch" all day.

— Joe Reid (@joereid) July 24, 2012

Breaking Bad: Sit-down showdowns where even the chairs ache and worn-out faces turned western landscapes. Old man TV. The way I like it.

— Brandon 🚷 (@bnowalk) July 24, 2012

Walt kissing Skyler is the most terrifying thing I've ever seen. #BreakingBad

— Jamie Rosengard (@jamieeros) July 24, 2012

A LITERAL STANDING OVATION. Your hero, Will McAvoy. #fuckingkillme #Newsroom

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 24, 2012

@TVandDinners The Rudy thing is the worst extended metaphor I've ever seen executed on television. And I'm counting my high school CCTV.

— Nick Campbell (@sononick) July 24, 2012

I keep watching NEWSROOM hoping it will get better, but I feel like it's the TV equivalent of the Chicago Cubs. #potentialbutnodelivery

— Meredith Hindley (@CapitolClio) July 24, 2012

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
But ultimately, Buddy Garrity would still love his little girl if she made a sex tape.

The Minka Kelly sex tape was shot in New Mexico. Once again proving: THOSE TAX CREDITS WORK!

Holdup! Minka Kelly has a sex tape?! Hold my goddamn calls.

People who are frustrated by me talking about race and gender on TV: do you know how much I'd love for this to be ACTUALLY SOLVED?

Every time you mislabel Sally Ride as "the first lesbian in space," Rosie from The Jetsons pounds another stein of oil at a Portland tavern.

Sure but needs lots of raw meat and sexual attention RT @asesina_cereal can I please borrow Adam for like a day or two?”
